org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Interface Transaction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ThreadContextTransactionManager.ThreadedTransaction

    public interface Transaction
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Represents a transaction in the XFlat database.
    While in context and open, the database will operate with the isolation level specified in the TransactionOptions given at the time this transaction was opened.

    When committed, the data modified by this transaction will be durably saved to disk, and immediately will be available to transactionless reads as well as new transactions.

    When closed, if a transaction has not been committed, it will be automatically reverted.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the current transaction.
      void commit()
      Commits the transaction immediately.
      long getCommitId()

      Gets the options with which this transaction was opened.
      long getTransactionId()
      Gets the ID of this transaction.
      boolean isCommitted()
      Returns true if the transaction has been committed.
      boolean isReverted()
      Returns true if the transaction has been reverted.
      void putTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Adds a transaction listener for this transaction, if it does not already exist.
      void removeTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Removes a transaction listener for this transaction.
      void revert()
      Reverts the transaction immediately.
      void setRevertOnly()
      Sets the transaction to be "Revert Only".

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        void commit()
            throws TransactionException
        Commits the transaction immediately. Transactions are committed atomically and durably, so that the instant this method returns successfully, the caller can be assured that the modifications performed by this transaction have been saved to disk.
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if an error occurred during the commit. The transaction manager will automatically revert the transaction upon a commit error.
        IllegalTransactionStateException - if the transaction has already been committed, reverted, or is revert only.

      • revert

        void revert()
        Reverts the transaction immediately. When a transaction is reverted, the database acts as though all the modifications performed inside the transaction scope never happened.

      • setRevertOnly

        void setRevertOnly()
        Sets the transaction to be "Revert Only". The transaction will continue as normal, but will throw an IllegalStateException if commit() is called.

      • getTransactionId

        long getTransactionId()
        Gets the ID of this transaction. A Transaction's ID is linked to the time it was created, so a transaction with a higher ID is guaranteed to have been created later. Transaction IDs are also valid across multiple tables.
        Returns:
        The transaction's ID.

      • getCommitId

        long getCommitId()
        Gets the commit ID of this transaction. A transaction has a commit ID if it has been committed. This commit ID is also linked to the time it was created, and can be compared to other transaction IDs to see if this transaction was committed before, during, or after another transaction.
        Returns:
        The transaction's commit ID, or -1 if uncommitted.

      • isCommitted

        boolean isCommitted()
        Returns true if the transaction has been committed.
        Returns:
        true iff the transaction successfully committed.

      • isReverted

        boolean isReverted()
        Returns true if the transaction has been reverted.
        Returns:
        true iff the transaction was reverted.

      • getOptions

        TransactionOptions getOptions()
        Gets the options with which this transaction was opened.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the current transaction. If the transaction has yet to be committed or reverted, the transaction is reverted immediately.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • putTransactionListener

        void putTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
        Adds a transaction listener for this transaction, if it does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add to this transaction.

      • removeTransactionListener

        void removeTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
        Removes a transaction listener for this transaction.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove from this transaction.
